prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construction of a curved rectangular prism** The first part is a curved rectangular prism with the following dimensions: length - 0.75 units, width - 0.1154 units, and height - 0.75 units. **Step 1: Creating the coordinate system** Create a new coordinate system with Euler angles as (0, 0, -90) degrees and translation vector as (0, 0.1154, 0). **Step 2: Creating the 2D sketch** On the X-Y plane of the created coordinate system, create a 2D sketch with the following loops and lines: - Loop 1: Four lines forming a rectangle. - Line 1: Start point (0, 0), End point (0.75, 0). - Line 2: Start point (0.75, 0), End point (0.7212, 0.1154). - Line 3: Start point (0.7212, 0.1154), End point (0.0288, 0.1154). - Line 4: Start point (0.0288, 0.1154), End point (0, 0). **Step 3: Scaling the 2D sketch** Scale the created sketch by a factor of 0.75. **Step 4: Transforming the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the same coordinate system. **Step 5: Extruding the 2D sketch** Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.1154 units. **Part 2: Construction of a rectangular prism with a cylindrical rod** The second part is a rectangular prism with a smaller rectangular prism on top of it, connected by a cylindrical rod. The dimensions are as follows: length - 0.75 units, width - 0.75 units, and height - 0.0577 units. **Step 1: Creating the coordinate system** Create a new coordinate system with Euler angles as (0, 0, 180) degrees and translation vector as (0, 0.0721, 0). **Step 2: Creating the 2D sketch** On the X-Y plane of the created coordinate system, create a 2D sketch with the following loops and lines: - Loop 1: Four lines forming a rectangle. - Line 1: Start point (0, 0), End point (0.1538, 0). - Line 2: Start point (0.1538, 0), End point (0.1538, 0.0288). - Line 3: Start point (0.1538, 0.0288), End point (0, 0.0288). - Line 4: Start point (0, 0.0288), End point (0, 0). - Loop 2: Four lines forming a rectangle. - Line 1: Start point (0.5962, 0), End point (0.75, 0). - Line 2: Start point (0.75, 0), End point (0.75, 0.0288). - Line 3: Start point (0.75, 0.0288), End point (0.5962, 0.0288). - Line 4: Start point (0.5962, 0.0288), End point (0.5962, 0). **Step 3: Scaling the 2D sketch** Scale the created sketch by a factor of 0.75. **Step 4: Transforming the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the same coordinate system. **Step 5: Extruding the 2D sketch** Extrude the 2D sketch along the opposite normal direction by 0.0577 units. Perform a cut operation with the first part to create the cylindrical rod connecting the two rectangular prisms.</description>

Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.1553, 0.0] Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch Draw the 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system. Face 1 Create a loop with the following curves: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.2863, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.2863, 0.0], End Point [0.2863, 0.6069] - Arc 1: Start Point [0.2863, 0.6069], Mid Point [0.1431, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.6069] - Line 3: Start Point [0.0, 0.6069], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Face 2 Create a loop with one circle: - Circle 1: Center [0.1431, 0.6069], Radius 0.072 Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Step 4: Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following parameters: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.1553 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector to create the 3D model with the following properties: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.1553 - Height: 0.75 Step 6: Perform a boolean operation Perform a boolean operation between the newly created part and the previous part using the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" option. The description of the part is as follows: ```json { "shape": "A rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism has a flat top and bottom. The hole is cylindrical with a smaller diameter than the prism. The prism is centered on the x-axis and is slightly offset on the y-axis. The height of the prism is approximately twice the width. The hole is located in the center of the prism. The prism is made of a solid material.</", "length": 0.75, "width": 0.1553, "height": 0.75 } ``` Note: The measurements in this description may not exactly match the actual dimensions of the part due to the scaling factor and boolean operation.</description>
